note.text: A second major conflict is over the role of religion. After 1977, General Zia-ul-Haq moved to Islamize the country. He set up the Council of Islamic Ideology to ensure that laws were in line with religious principles.

Relations between religious groups were peaceful up until this point. Soon thereafter, violence increased both between Muslim sects and against secular Pakistanis. In 1985, blasphemy laws were enacted. These laws have been used to silence believers in minority religions.
Later politicians followed Zia's lead. Clerics continue to have tremendous influence, especially in rural areas.
